TopicTitle: Laythecat is bestcat. (Chobit's house of madness) The one thread to rule them all!

Articles.Content:
I swear by my grandfather's kilt that I WILL get someone on this forum hooked on SBY

... I suppose my borderline fascination doesn't count, as I know you outside of the forum...

Enterprise? BAH!!! My heart only has room for ONE starship!

NCC-1701 was only named after a WWII warship, BBY-1 was BUILT from one! <3

-snip-

I swear by my grandfather's kilt that I WILL get someone on this forum hooked on SBY

Space Battleshop Llamato!

Hehehehehe, Star Trek Online. That game stole 500 hours of my life then ripped me off for much much moneys. Love how it doesn't mention CV-6 Yorktown-class Enterprise. It should also be noted that a new USS Enterprise (CVN-80) will be entering service in 2025

And a nuclear submarine could work, I'm just wondering about how the hull would handle the reverse pressure.

[EDIT]:

Space Battleshop Llamato!

*beats you to death with your own skull*

Hehehehehe, Star Trek Online. That game stole 500 hours of my life then ripped me off for much much moneys. Love how it doesn't mention CV-6 Yorktown-class Enterprise. It should also be noted that a new USS Enterprise (CVN-80) will be entering service in 2025

Eh, that feature was introduced awhile ago so not the best info, they probably just chose the interesting ones. Also, now the games free so, in theory, you can do it without spending money but they bombard you with sooooooo many adverts for things its annoying.

I thought that the double Lls are Welsh and Kilts Scottish?

Edit: And how do you beat someone to death with their own skull?

Edited May 19, 2013 by LeonG17

And a nuclear submarine could work, I'm just wondering about how the hull would handle the reverse pressure.

The hull was reskinned anyway. Nuclear subs are designed to have an ocean's worth of cooling water to pump through a condenser.

What this one did is they removed the condenser, and replaced the outer plates of the hull with a double wall heat exchanger. Leftover steam goes to the plates near the surface, where the heat is radiated and the water condenses to return to the cooling system. There's also provision to isolate damaged panels just in case, since you end up with a fairly vulnerable function of the vessel exposed on its surface. Though it's designed as a light freighter, so it isn't expected to have to deal with much more than micrometeorites.

The skeleton of it should handle the vacuum of space much easier than the pressure of 200 meters of water, since the steel trusswork used to make that happen would have similar properties in either direction. Redoing the surface of it enabled the addition of an improved seal to make it airtight instead of just watertight.

Edited May 19, 2013 by OdinYggd

NO! She will bombard us from orbit with the Yamato! But either way we need to dig. Everyone, grab one of these and dig:

Oh crap, Chobit's going to nuke us from orbit. Start digging!

Her base is the Yamato! She will shoot anything that goes near it. We need to DIG!!!!!
The Orbital Defense Squad is invading the Yamato! They will invade the spaceship and detonate the nukes in it!

Her base is the Yamato! She will shoot anything that goes near it. We need to DIG!!!!!

Scans show a pure-oxygen respiration system. I say we send a remote zippo lighter. Send it in the dark, pop it in the airlock. She won't notice it.
I know the solution. (warning: extended exposure to tv tropes may ruin your life)

She would just fit bullet proof armour:

No matter what we do, she will survive. We need to DIG!
I'm just gonna sit here in this ol' rocking chair and watch the fireworks.
Don't worry, you will soon see fireworks heading straight to you:

THe nukes onboard the Yamato have been detonated before they could be deployed! The spaceship has been torn in half!
